benchmark_details.name: Combi-Puzzles
benchmark_details.overview: The Combi-Puzzles dataset contains 125 problem variants based on 25 combinatorial reasoning problems, designed to evaluate the mathematical reasoning abilities of large language models (LLMs) and human participants.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the reasoning ability of established LLMs in combinatorial problems and to compare their performance with human participants.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset contains only 125 problem variants, which may not fully capture the diversity of scenarios LLMs can encounter.

data.source: Constructed by the authors for this study using combinatorial problems.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy was calculated as the number of correct responses over the total number of problems attempted.
methodology.interpretation: A higher accuracy indicates better reasoning capabilities in solving combinatorial problems.
methodology.validation: Statistical significance was tested using the paired Permutation test.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Participants were recruited from Ukrainian pupils and undergraduates involved in STEM, with an emphasis on prior experience in combinatorial mathematics.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Participants provided informed consent, and data collection was conducted anonymously.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent was obtained from participants and parental consent for minor participants.
